show_environment

Source: R/show-environment.R
show_environment.Rd

Show memory use

Usage

show_environment(
  what = NULL,
  sort = "size",
  units = "Mb",
  decreasing = TRUE,
  n = NULL
)

Arguments

what

List with objects to show object size. If NULL all objects in environment are used.

sort

Sort the resulting dataframe either by "size", "name".

units

Unit used to format memory usage. For more details, see ?object.size.

decreasing

Logical if results should be sorted in decreasing order.

n

Number of top rows to print.

Value

data.frame

Details

Functions returns the name, class and size of all objects in the environment. The resulting data frame can be sorted by different arguments.

See also

object.size

Examples

vec <- 1:100
vec_2 <- runif(n = 10)
df <- data.frame(1:5000)
mat <- matrix(c(1:100), ncol = 20, nrow = 5)
list <- list(x = vec, y = df, z = mat)

show_environment()
#> Error in get(x): object 'mat' not found
